result.execSummary:
The defendant Chaz Landon Holifield was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs, surcharges and assessments, this includes victim witness, domestic violence and DNA surcharge.  Any cash bail posted on this case to be applied.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
DOC to collect monetary amounts/sums at the rate of 25% of prison funds.
*Restitution set at zero.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with sentence imposed as to case 14CF004629.

superMiscConds.notes:
No drugs without a valid prescription.
No contact with the victim without the approval of the Court.  Third party contact for purpose of child visitation as approved by the agent.
No contact with firearms.

Attend and successfuly complete a BIP program.
Attend and successfully complete a parenting class.
Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation.
Pay supervision fees as determined by Wisconsin Department of Corrections.
AODA assessment.  Comply with any treatment.  Absolute sobriety.

supervisions.notes: Court advised defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor; and he must provide a DNA sample and pay the mandatory DNA surcharge, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chaz Landon Holifield

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel, Alicia B., and defendant.  COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms or body armor, he must provide a DNA sample and pay the mandatory DNA surcharge and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE - 3  years with 92 days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  1 year, CONCURRENT to the sentence imposed as to Case# 14CF004629  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  2 years

Defendant is not eligible for the Earned Release Program and is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program

Terms of Extended Supervision:
- Attend and successfully complete a BIP training program
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Absolute Sobriety
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- Attend and successfully complete a Parenting class
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation
- Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)
- No contact with the victim without the approval of the court
- 3rd party contact for purpose of child visitation as approved by the agent
- Seek/maintain employment
- Pay all costs, surcharges and assessments (this includes victim/witness, domestic violence and DNA surcharge).  Any cash bail posted on this case to be applied to costs and surcharges owed.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Pay supervision fees as determined by the Wisconsin Dept. of Corrections
- No contact with firearms

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis;
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed. 
Copies given to the defendant.

Defendant Chaz Landon Holifield in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Defendant Chaz Landon Holifield in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has four cases before the court.

Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders "repeater" penalty enhancer DISMISSED.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY to the amended charge.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty of the amended charge and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.
Clerk:  jms

Attorney Thomas John Erickson in court, defendant Chaz Landon Holifield not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court involved in a jury trial.  Matter rescheduled.  Plea hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas John Erickson in court, defendant Chaz Landon Holifield not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Off the record.  Upon the request of parties, Plea and Sentencing Hearing rescheduled to Branch 4 on 4-20-2015 at 1:30 pm.  Court vacates the Jury Trial date of 4-20-2015 at 8:30 am, Branch 4.   mld

Attorney Thomas John Erickson in court, defendant Chaz Landon Holifield not in court, in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 4-9-2015 at 8:30 am.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial in Branch 4 on 4-20-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld

Motion of the State to Modify Bail is heard and granted by the Court.  Court ordered forfeiture of the cash bail on the following cases as follows; $2,000.00 on case 2014CF4629, $1,000.00 on case 2014CF1619 and $1,500.00 on case 2014CF1374.    mld

Defendant Chaz Landon Holifield in court with attorney Thomas John Erickson.  Defendant Chaz Landon Holifield in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Upon the request of the State, Court takes judicial notice of the certified documents attached to the Criminal Complaint.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Jeffrey Emanuelson.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Upon the motion of the State, the Court ordered the following cases consolidated for the purposes of trial; 2014CF1374, 2014CF1619, 2014CF4629 and 2015CF472.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 3-4-2015 at 8:30 am and Jury Trial on 4-20-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Brittney M

Defendant Chaz Landon Holifield in court with attorney Debra J. Patterson.  Defendant Chaz Landon Holifield in custody.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.
